sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"偷，抢，夺"之意。
means: rob ： 最常用词，指用暴力恐吓或哄骗等非法手段抢夺财物。
steal ： 普通用词，指暗中行窃。
plunder ： 指大规模或大范围地掠夺。
deprive ： 多指夺去或扣留别人拥有或可能拥有的有价值或必需的东西，也可用于指抽象的事物。

sentence.Network_en: This law will deprive us of our most basic rights.
sentence.Network_cn: 这条法律将剥夺我们最基本的权利.

sentence.Network_en: To deprive the boy of his education is a violation of state law.
sentence.Network_cn: 剥夺这个男孩受教育的权利是一种违反国家法律的行为。

sentence.Network_en: You even want to deprive us of the freedom of our hearts.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们心里的自由你都要剥夺了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... privity n 私事 deprive v 剥夺，夺去 deprivation n 剥夺；丧失.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... privity n 私事 deprive v 剥夺，夺去 deprivation n 剥夺；丧失.
《Friends》词汇表B ... shore n. 岸, 海滨, 支撑柱 deprive vt. 剥夺, 使丧失 nutmeg n. 肉豆蔻, 肉豆蔻种子中的核仁.
大学英语六级词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... depression n． 经济萧条 deprive vt． 夺去；使(人)失去 deputy n． 代理人，代表，副警长.

list.abs: 化学去势（androgen deprivation） 　　化学去势（androgen deprivation）（Androgen Deprivation），其实是以雌性激素（女性贺尔蒙）、抗雄性激素（睾丸抑制剂）或性腺刺激激素抑制 …
maternal course 慈幼班maternal deprivation 【心理】母爱剥夺maternal effect 母体效应
...Walter的神秘水箱在本剧第一集就出现了，这也不是什么新鲜玩意。科学家很早就发现了一种叫做"感觉剥夺（sensory deprivation） "的心理现象－ －他们将实验对象长期隔离在密封的、无光的房间或箱子里，观察实验对象身体与心理所产生的.
[33]汤森则从社会剥夺（Social Deprivation）角度分析弱势群体生活贫困问题，他认为，如果人们缺少必要的满足生活条件的某种物品 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'depose from office'): from Old French depriver, from medieval Latin deprivare, from de- 'away, completely' + privare (see private)

entry.tran: 剥夺;使丧失;使不能享有
entry.def: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it.

example.ex: The disintegration of the Soviet Union deprived western intelligence agencies of their main enemies...
example.tran: 苏联解体使西方情报机构丧失了主敌。

example.ex: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
example.tran: 他们没法得到家里取暖所必需的燃料。

sentences.sentence: "The Nazis stripped the Jews of all their assets"

means.word_mean: 2. keep from having, keeping, or obtaining

stems_affixes.value_cn: 私人的,个人的,秘密的,私下的

stems_affixes.word_buile: priv单个+y……的,人→个人的→秘密的,引申为有厉害关系的人
private个人的+ly表副词→adv.私下地, 秘密地
deprive[v.剥夺,夺去,使丧失]+ation表名词→n.剥夺,丧失

stems_affixes.value_cn: [不受干扰的]独处,自由,隐私;私生活
stems_affixes.word_buile: priv单个+acy表名词→n.[不受干扰的]独处,自由,隐私;私生活
privi=priv单个+lege法律→有个人法律→特权
priv单个+y……的,人→个人的→秘密的,引申为有厉害关系的人
de去掉+priv单个+e→从个人身边拿走→剥夺
privi=priv单个+lege法律→有个人法律→特权

Sentence.sentence: The author tends to believe that high unemployment rate deprives many people of job opportunities.
deprives many people of job opportunities
A cheater doesn't learn from the test, which deprives (剥夺) him her of an education.
For one, it deprives students of the luxury of time to roam (遨游) intellectually.
The profound connection between identity and communication is dramatically evident in children who are deprived of human contact.

means.word_mean: 剥夺；使丧失；使不能享有
